snippet: A technician for the state-run broadcaster Radio Mogadishu was killed by two armed men outside his home on Saturday, and another man was executed for killing a journalist last year.
abstract: Ahmed Sharif, technician for state-run broadcaster Radio Mogadishu, becomes sixth media employee killed so far this year in Somalia, one of most dangerous countries in world for journalists; Somali government, in effort to crack down on attacks against news media, executes man found guilty of 2012 murder of journalist.

byline.original: By MOHAMMED IBRAHIM and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Mohammed Ibrahim reported from Mogadishu, and Nicholas Kulish from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: A technician for the state-run broadcaster Radio Mogadishu was killed by two armed men outside his home on Saturday, and another man was executed for killing a journalist last year.

headline.main: Radio Station Employee Is Shot Dead in Somalia
headline.print_headline: Radio Station Employee Is Shot Dead in Somalia
